data.name: ClassPropertyShouldBePubliclyReadOnlyDescription
data.value: Public classes should not provide publicly accessible setters for properties

data.name: ClassPropertyShouldBePubliclyReadOnlyMessageFormat
data.value: Public property `{0}` of class `{1}` should not define a public setter

data.name: ClassPropertyShouldBePubliclyReadOnlyTitle
data.value: Public properties defined in public classes should be publicly read-only (no public setter)

data.name: DoNotUseNotImplementedExceptionDescription
data.value: The NotImplementedException is a direct violation of the Liskov Substitution Principle (LSP) and so must not be used

data.name: DoNotUseNotImplementedExceptionMessageFormat
data.value: Throw statement uses the NotImplementedException, which is a violation of the LSP

data.name: DoNotUseNotImplementedExceptionTitle
data.value: The NotImplementedException violates the Liskov Substitution Principle (LSP)

data.name: FileMustOnlyContainOneTypeDefinitionDescription
data.value: To comply with the single responsibility principle, a file should only contain one non-private type definition.

data.name: FileMustOnlyContainOneTypeDefinitionMessageFormat
data.value: Type `{0}` is located in a file that contains other type definitions

data.name: FileMustOnlyContainOneTypeDefinitionTitle
data.value: A file should only contain one type definition

data.name: InnerTypesMustBePrivateDescription
data.value: Inner types should be treated as implementation details and encapsulated by marking them as private

data.name: InnerTypesMustBePrivateMessageFormat
data.value: Type `{0}` is defined inside another type, so should be made private

data.name: InnerTypesMustBePrivateTitle
data.value: Inner type declarations should be marked private

data.name: InterfacePropertiesShouldBeReadonlyDescription
data.value: To provide encapsulation, properties should only make getters publicly available, so interfaces should not define setters for properties.

data.name: InterfacePropertiesShouldBeReadonlyMessageFormat
data.value: Property `{0}` of interface `{1}` should not define a setter

data.name: InterfacePropertiesShouldBeReadonlyTitle
data.value: Properties defined in interfaces should be read-only (no setter)

data.name: MethodParameterMustNotBeRefOrOutDescription
data.value: Method parameters must not use REF or OUT parameters; all results should be via a return

data.name: MethodParameterMustNotBeRefOrOutMessageFormat
data.value: Parameter `{0}` of method `{1}` must not use {2}

data.name: MethodParameterMustNotBeRefOrOutTitle
data.value: Method parameters must not use REF or OUT

data.name: MethodShouldNotContainAndDescription
data.value: Method names that contain "And" often indicate a method is doing more than one thing. Consider refacting into two methods.

data.name: MethodShouldNotContainAndMessageFormat
data.value: Method '{0}' contains "And", which might indicate it's doing more than one thing

data.name: MethodShouldNotContainAndTitle
data.value: Methods should not contain the word "And"

data.name: StaticMethodMustHaveAtLeastOneParameterDescription
data.value: Static methods should have at least one parameter

data.name: StaticMethodMustHaveAtLeastOneParameterMessageFormat
data.value: Static method '{0}' doesn't have any parameters. It should have at least one

data.name: StaticMethodMustHaveAtLeastOneParameterTitle
data.value: Static methods must have at least one parameter

data.name: StaticMethodMustNotBeVoidDescription
data.value: Static methods should return a value (must not be null)

data.name: StaticMethodMustNotBeVoidMessageFormat
data.value: Static method '{0}' is void. It should return a value

data.name: StaticMethodMustNotBeVoidTitle
data.value: Static methods must not be void
